oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Measuring the Therapeutic Efficacy of Antibiotics: A Method for Practitioners
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dohoo, Ian R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: antibiotics
bacterial infection
field condition
products
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Every year, veterinarians and beef producers administer millions of doses of antibiotics to cattle. Yet very little work has been carried out to determine the efficacy of those treatments. It is assumed that antibiotic treatment of cattle with bacterial infections is advantageous, but given the wide variety of antibiotics available, it is surprising that there is very little evidence as to which products are most effective under field conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 160-163
